org.qdt.quingo.validation

Class QuingoValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.xtext.validation.AbstractInjectableValidator
      • org.eclipse.xtext.validation.AbstractDeclarativeValidator
        • org.qdt.quingo.validation.AbstractQuingoValidator
          • org.qdt.quingo.typing.validation.QuingoSemanticsValidator
            • org.qdt.quingo.validation.QuingoValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EValidator, org.eclipse.xtext.validation.ValidationMessageAcceptor

    public class QuingoValidator
extends QuingoSemanticsValidator
    This class contains custom validation rules.

    See https://www.eclipse.org/Xtext/documentation/303_runtime_concepts.html#validation

    Author:
    Jintao Yu

      • checkAssignment

        public void checkAssignment(Assignment stat)
        Check whether the left side of an Assignment is legal.

        Legal left side expressions include variables, array accesses, and tuples consisting with the previous two types.

        Parameters:
        stat - the assignment statement to be checked

      • checkLeftSide

        public java.lang.Boolean checkLeftSide(Expression exp)
        Check whether the left side of an Assignment is legal.

        Legal left side expressions include variables, array accesses, and tuples consisting with the previous two types.

        Parameters:
        exp - the Expression on the left side of an Assignment
        Returns:
        whether it is legal
